intro: Michelia compressa var. latifolia, commonly known as the broadleaf michelia, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its broad, lance-shaped leaves and fragrant white flowers that bloom in spring. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks. It belongs to the family Magnoliaceae, which includes other aromatic flowering plants. Its botanical features make it a valuable species for both ornamental and ecological purposes.
